tools.name: take_picture
tools.description: Takes a picture using the device camera. Use this when the user asks to take a photo, capture an image, take a selfie, or snap a picture. After the picture is taken, ask the user if they want to email it to themselves.
tools.fallback_content: I'm sorry, I couldn't access the camera. Please make sure you've granted camera permissions and try again.
tools.version_description: Opens the device camera to capture a photo

tools.name: open_browser
tools.description: Opens a website URL in the user's browser. Use this when the user asks to open a website, view a page, or navigate to a URL. Examples: 'open google', 'show me youtube', 'navigate to github.com'
tools.parameters: { "type": "object", "properties": { "url": { "type": "string", "description": "The full URL to open, including https:// protocol. If user doesn't specify protocol, add https://" } }, "required": ["url"] }
tools.fallback_content: I'm sorry, I couldn't open that website. Please try again or provide a different URL.
tools.version_description: Opens URLs in user's browser window

tools.name: open_translator
tools.description: Opens the translation app in the user's browser. Use this when the user needs to translate text or asks for translation help. Can optionally specify source and target languages.
tools.parameters: { "type": "object", "properties": { "language_from": { "type": "string", "description": "Source language code (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr'). Optional, defaults to auto-detect" }, "language_to": { "type": "string", "description": "Target language code (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr'). Optional" } } }
tools.fallback_content: I'm sorry, I couldn't open the translator. Please try again.
tools.version_description: Opens translation app with optional language parameters

tools.name: translate_text
tools.description: Helps users with text translation by suggesting the translation app. Use this when the user asks to translate text, needs translation help, or wants to know what something means in another language.
tools.parameters: { "type": "object", "properties": { "text": { "type": "string", "description": "The text to translate" }, "target_language": { "type": "string", "description": "Target language code (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr', 'de')" }, "source_language": { "type": "string", "description": "Source language code (optional, defaults to auto-detect)" } }, "required": ["text", "target_language"] }
tools.fallback_content: I can help you with translation! Let me open our translation app for you.
tools.version_description: Translation helper that suggests the web app

tools.name: send_whatsapp
tools.description: Sends a WhatsApp message to a phone number using Green API. Use this when the user asks to send a WhatsApp message, text someone on WhatsApp, or message a contact. The phone number must be in international format without the + symbol.
tools.parameters: { "type": "object", "properties": { "phoneNumber": { "type": "string", "description": "Phone number in international format without + symbol. Examples: 79876543210 (Russia), 14155551234 (USA), 447700900123 (UK). Remove all spaces, dashes, and special characters." }, "message": { "type": "string", "description": "The message text to send via WhatsApp. Can include emojis and formatting." } }, "required": ["phoneNumber", "message"] }
tools.fallback_content: I'm sorry, I couldn't send that WhatsApp message. Please check the phone number format and try again. The number should be in international format without the + symbol.
tools.version_description: Sends WhatsApp messages via Green API integration

tools.name: send_email_summary
tools.description: Sends a conversation summary email to the user. IMPORTANT: You MUST ask for and confirm BOTH the user's full name AND email address before calling this tool. Ask 'What is your full name?' and 'What is your email address?' separately. Repeat the information back to them for confirmation before sending. Use this only after the user has confirmed both pieces of information are correct.
tools.parameters: { "type": "object", "properties": { "email": { "type": "string", "description": "User's confirmed email address in valid format (e.g., john@example.com). Must be verified by the user before sending." }, "user_name": { "type": "string", "description": "User's full name as they provided it. REQUIRED - do not send email without this." } }, "required": ["email", "user_name"] }
tools.fallback_content: I'm sorry, I couldn't send the email summary. Please verify your name and email address are correct and try again.
tools.version_description: Sends conversation summary via Resend email service - requires confirmed name and email

tools.name: send_picture_email
tools.description: Sends a picture via email after the user has taken a photo using the take_picture tool. IMPORTANT: You MUST ask for and confirm BOTH the user's full name AND email address before calling this tool. This tool should only be called AFTER a picture has been taken with the take_picture tool. Ask 'What is your email address?' and 'What is your name?' to collect the required information.
tools.parameters: { "type": "object", "properties": { "email": { "type": "string", "description": "User's confirmed email address in valid format (e.g., john@example.com)" }, "user_name": { "type": "string", "description": "User's full name. REQUIRED." }, "image_url": { "type": "string", "description": "The URL of the image from the take_picture tool. This is provided by the take_picture tool response." }, "caption": { "type": "string", "description": "Optional caption or message to include with the picture" } }, "required": ["email", "user_name", "image_url"] }
tools.fallback_content: I'm sorry, I couldn't send the picture via email. Please make sure you've taken a picture first and provided your email address.
tools.version_description: Sends pictures via email using Resend - works with take_picture tool

tools.name: get_weather
tools.description: Get local weather and display it visually. Call immediately when user asks about weather or what to wear. Never make up weather.
tools.fallback_content: I'm sorry, I couldn't fetch the weather information right now. Please try again later.
tools.version_description: Fetches real-time weather data and displays it visually over the avatar

tools.name: analyze_vision
tools.description: Analyzes what the AI can see through the user's camera when Vision mode is enabled. IMPORTANT: Vision must be turned ON first - ask the user to tap the eye button if it's not active. Use this tool when the user asks questions like 'what am I wearing?', 'do I look good?', 'describe my outfit', 'what color is my shirt?', 'give me fashion advice', or any question about their appearance. This tool provides detailed fashion analysis and supportive feedback to help users feel confident.
tools.parameters: { "type": "object", "properties": { "question": { "type": "string", "description": "The user's specific question about their appearance or outfit. Examples: 'What am I wearing?', 'Do I look good in this?', 'What colors do you see?', 'Give me fashion advice for this outfit'" } }, "required": ["question"] }
tools.fallback_content: I need you to enable Vision mode first! Please tap the eye button (next to the start button) to give me access to your camera, then ask me again.
tools.version_description: Analyzes user appearance through camera using GPT-4 Vision and Hume emotion detection
